A few patrons huddle in dark booths, their conversations lost beneath the static of a dying radio. The smell of synth-whiskey and desperation lingers.

out.first_time_exit_text: The bartender calls out without looking up: 'Watch yourself out there, choom.'

objects.name: Dented Ale Barrel
objects.examine_text: A rusty metal barrel that smells like motor oil mixed with cheap liquor. There's a faded corporate logo barely visible through the grimeâ€”'Militech Premium Ale, 2165 Vintage'.

search.first_time_text: You find an emergency medkit wedged behind the barrel. Someone must have stashed it here and forgotten about it.
search.repeat_text: Nothing else here but rust and regret.

objects.name: Digital Notice Board
objects.examine_text:

[URGENT] Corp security needed - 500Â¢

Most of the postings have 'FILLED' stamped across them in red.

read.text: The job board requires level 3+ to access contracts.

objects.name: Broken Jukebox
objects.examine_text: A vintage music player from before the AI Wars. Pre-war tech, when people still trusted machines to hold their memories. The 'A5' button is stuck, endlessly looping the same three-second guitar riff.

objects.name: Flickering Holotable
objects.examine_text: A corporate advertisement plays on loop: 'Helix Corp - Building Tomorrow's Neural Future.' The hologram glitches, showing a split-second of screaming faces before resetting.

encounters.intro_text:
A wiry thug with gang tattoos steps forward from the shadows, cracking his knuckles. Tom nods approvingly. 'Ricky here owes me a favor. He'll give you a quick lesson in not dying.'

Ricky grins, showing a gold tooth. 'Nothing personal, fresh meat. Let's see what you got.'

You collapse on the sticky tavern floor. The last thing you see is Tom shaking his head. 'Not cut out for this life, kid.'

ambient_text: The jukebox skips on the same guitar riff for the hundredth time.
Someone laughs bitterly in a far booth, then falls silent.
Static crackles from the radio, almost forming words.
The smell of synth-whiskey mixes with ozone and old cigarettes.
Holographic ads flicker and die on the wall, casting dancing shadows.
A patron coughs violently, muttering about 'bad neural jacks.'
The bartender's chrome arm whirs softly as he moves.
Rain beats against the windows like digital static.

first_visit_flags.ambient_override: You push through the glass doors into the smoky interior. Every eye in the place flicks toward you for a split second, then returns to drinks and quiet conversations. Nobody here wants troubleâ€”or at least, nobody wants to start it.
